fancymenu.fancymenu.editor.dynamicvariab:
Picks a random line from a TXT file, URL or direct plain text.

Supports local files, remote URLs and plain text as "source":
- Local files: Use relative paths (e.g. '/config/fancymenu/assets/tips.txt')
- Remote files: Use HTTP/HTTPS URLs (e.g. 'https://example.com/tips.txt')
- Plain text: Input direct plain text. Separate lines with "\n".

Content is automatically reloaded every 30 seconds to pick up changes.

The 'interval' parameter controls how often a new random line is selected
from the loaded content (in seconds).

An interval of 0 will make it pick a line only once per session.

For local files, just replace '<file_name.txt>' with your file path.
Local files HAVE to be placed in FancyMenu's ASSETS folder!

fancymenu.helper.editor.items.features.a:
§xONLY FOR ADVANCED USERS!

Allows you to manually set the
position of the element.

Advanced positions support placeholders,
so you can calculate positions
by using the Calculator placeholder,
get positions of other elements
and much more.

Many useful placeholders for element
positioning can be found
in the "GUI" and "Advanced"
placeholder categories.

§xYou will not be able to resize or
§xdrag and move the element while this
§xfeature is in use.

§xONLY FOR ADVANCED USERS!

and much more.

§xoverridden by an advanced size.

§x§lAre you sure?

The requirement mode defines what
the requirement should tell its parent
when its condition is met.

§zNORMAL §rmeans, it returns TRUE ("Yes, load!")
when its condition is met.

§zOPPOSITE §rmeans, it returns TRUE when
its condition is NOT met.

§zThis requirement has no value.
§zYou don't need to set one.
Edit the value of the chosen requirement.
§xYou need to select a requirement first!
§xYou need to edit the requirement value first!

The group mode defines how the group
should handle its requirements.

§zAND §rmeans, ALL requirements need
to be TRUE, which basically just
means they need to say "Yes, load!".

§zOR §rmeans, only ONE requirement
needs to be TRUE.
§xYou need to add at least one requirement first!

§xThe group identifier is already used
§xfor another group!
Add a requirement to this group.
§xYou need to select a requirement first!

Add a new requirement group.

Requirement groups can hold multiple
requirements and basically
make them one big requirement.

Requirement groups have two modes.
In §zAND §rmode, all requirements need
to return TRUE (which means "Yes, load!"),
but in §zOR §rmode, only one requirement
needs to return TRUE.
§xYou need to select a group or requirement!

supports setting a custom text source

is no bar texture defined for the element.

the bar color will be ignored.

this element as Element anchor.
That way other elements move with
the progress of the progress bar.

fancymenu.editor.actions.execute_termina: The action will only get executed for OSes that have a command.
If an unknown OS is used, the action will fallback to the Linux command.

text that is already typed in the input field.
The action will override existing text if this is disabled.
fancymenu.editor.layout.index.desc:
The layout index is useful when you have
multiple layouts active for the same screen.
If these layouts need to get loaded
in a specific order, use the layout index.
The bigger the index, the later the layout
gets loaded, which means it is ON TOP OF
layouts with a smaller index.

For example: A layout with index 1 will
be under a layout with index 2.
fancymenu.overlay.menu_bar.leave_current:

you back to the Title Screen.
Useful for when you're stuck in a screen
without an option to leave it.

elements (like images, custom buttons, etc.),
or after changing the GUI scale or other
options that need the screen to get updated.
It's basically the same as resizing the window.

fancymenu.resources.source_type.location:
This source type uses Minecraft's own resource
system to get resources, so in other words,
it can use resources of resource packs,
Vanilla Minecraft and mods.

Here you need to input the resource location
of the resource you want to use.
Resource locations consist of two parts.
The first part is the namespace and the second
part is the path.
These two parts are separated by a colon (:).

To learn more about resource locations,
please visit resources.fancymenu.net!
fancymenu.resources.source_type.local.de:
This source type lets you load local resources
saved in Minecraft's instance directory.
You need to save all of FancyMenu's resources
to '/config/fancymenu/assets/'.
fancymenu.resources.source_type.web.desc:
This source type lets you use web resources via URL.
Resource URLs should ALWAYS be DIRECT URLs,
which means they should point directly to the
resource and end with the resource's name + extension.
URLs also need to start with http:// or https://.

§xUsing non-direct URLs will hurt the performance!

If the screen is a Vanilla screen, please report this bug via GitHub.

In most cases this means FancyMenu failed to open the original screen
this button is part of, because the screen is not supported.
Most unsupported screens are non-Vanilla screens from other mods.

If the screen is a Vanilla screen, please report this bug via GitHub.

If an entity is nearby the player.
Takes the key of an entity and the check radius in blocks as value.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
[NO ENTITIES FOUND OR NOT IN A WORLD]
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_effect_a:
If an effect is currently active.
Takes the key of an effect as value.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
[NO EFFECTS FOUND OR NOT IN A WORLD]
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_any_effe:
If ANY effect is currently active.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_gamemode:
If the player is in a certain game mode.
Takes the name of a game mode as value.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_difficul:
If the world has a certain difficulty.
Takes the name of a difficulty as value.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
If it's currently raining at the player's position.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_thunderi:
If it's currently thundering.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_clear_we:
If it's currently clear weather.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
If it's currently snowing at the player's position.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_left_han:
If the player is left-handed.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_inventor:
If there's an item in a certain slot of the player's inventory.
This includes hotbar slots.
Takes the number of the target slot as value.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_hotbar_s:
If a certain hotbar slot (0-8) is currently active/selected.
Takes the number of the target hotbar slot (0-8) as value.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.requirements.world.is_attack_s:
If the player's attack strength is currently not at 100%.
In Vanilla, this means the Attack Indicator is visible.
Returns false when no world is loaded.
fancymenu.element.fading.fade_out.desc:
Fade-Out will NOT fade-out elements before opening a new menu!
It is meant to be used when elements change
their visibility via loading requirements.
fancymenu.element.fading.error.negative_:
Fading speed needs to be a positive and
valid floating point value (bigger than 0.0).
fancymenu.element.base_opacity.desc: Should be a floating point value between 0.0 and 1.0.
fancymenu.element.auto_sizing.desc:
Auto-sizing will try to adjust the element's size
based on the screen size, so it's never too big or
too small for the current screen size.

It is not recommended to use this when
§lauto-scaling §ris enabled in the layout.
fancymenu.element.sticky_anchor.desc:
In this mode, the element's position will get calculated
in a different way than normal.

This mode makes the element always keep the exact same distance
to its anchor, no matter the current size of the element.
This means the size of the element can dynamically change
without it moving away or getting closer to its anchor.
While this can be useful in some situations, there
are also cases where this behaviour is not optimal.

§xThis has NO EFFECT when using another element as anchor!
fancymenu.element.sticky_anchor.desc.dis: §xYou need to disable 'Stay on Screen' first to use this!
fancymenu.elements.button.active_state_c:
Control when/if the widget should be enabled (clickable)
or disabled (not clickable and greyed out).
fancymenu.welcome.screen.headline: Thank you for using FancyMenu!
fancymenu.welcome.screen.text:
Before you begin customizing with FancyMenu, please make sure to **read the documentation** thoroughly. While FancyMenu can seem overwhelming initially, the documentation will guide you step-by-step.

Start with the 'Getting Started' page for the basics of menu customization. Don’t forget to explore the other sections as they offer valuable insights and tips!

**Have a fantastic time with FancyMenu!**
fancymenu.welcome.screen.title: FancyMenu Welcome Screen
fancymenu.welcome.screen.open_docs.toolt:
The Welcome screen will not show up again
after clicking this button.
You don't need to manually edit any config files.
fancymenu.elements.dragger.desc:
The Dragger allows you to make parts of your layout dragable,
which means users can "grab" parts of layouts with
the mouse cursor and move them around.
fancymenu.elements.dragger.save_offset.d:
If the drag offset should be persistent
or reset every time the menu gets reopened.
fancymenu.actions.audio.set_audio_elemen:
Sets the volume of an Audio element by its identifier.
The volume is a value between 0.0 (0%%) and 1.0 (100%%).
fancymenu.placeholders.audio_element_vol:
Returns the volume of an Audio element
as a value between 0.0 (0%%) and 1.0 (100%%).
Takes the element identifier of the target Audio element.
fancymenu.requirements.is_key_pressed.de: Checks if a keyboard key is pressed.
fancymenu.requirements.is_key_pressed.sc: Press any key now to select it..
fancymenu.placeholders.split_text.desc:
Splits a text at a specific character or regex.

input = The text to split.
regex = The character or regex for where to split the text.
max_parts = The max parts the text should get split into. Setting this to -1 disables the limit.
split_index = The part that should get returned after splitting. Starts at 0.
fancymenu.placeholders.trim_text.desc:
Removes all leading and trailing spaces of the
given text, but not spaces within the text.
fancymenu.placeholders.crop_text.desc:
Removes a specific amount of characters from the
beginning and end of the given text.

text = The text to crop.
remove_from_start = Characters to remove from the beginning.
remove_from_end = Characters to remove from the end.
fancymenu.elements.browser.desc: A browser where you can load a URL (website) in.
fancymenu.elements.browser.mcef_not_load: You need to install MCEF (mod) to use this element!
fancymenu.elements.browser.url.desc: The URL the browser should load.
If the user should be able ot interact with the browser.
fancymenu.elements.browser.hide_video_co:
If the controls of all videos should be hidden.
This will probably not work in some cases.
fancymenu.elements.browser.loop_videos.d:
If all videos should loop.
This will probably not work in some cases.
fancymenu.elements.browser.mute_media.de:
If all audios and videos should get muted on load.
This will probably not work in some cases.
Set the base volume of media elements like audios and videos.
Should be a value between 0.0 (0%) and 1.0 (100%).
This will probably not work in some cases.
fancymenu.elements.browser.disabled_in_e: The browser is not interactive while in the editor!
fancymenu.backgrounds.color.desc:
A simple color background.

This type is PART OF THE BASE MOD unlike
the other similar type you might see in the types list.
fancymenu.elements.item.desc:
An item like a sword, apple or grass block.
For the extra bit of battle pass menu flair!
fancymenu.elements.item.name: Set Item Name
fancymenu.elements.item.lore.desc:
Set the lore of the item.
This input supports multiline and you
can even use 'Minecraft Text Components'.
Use one component (JSON) per line.

To learn more about text components, check this:
https://docs.fancymenu.net/en/text-formatting
fancymenu.elements.item.key.desc:
The registry key of the item.
Used to identify the item you want to display.
fancymenu.elements.item.nbt.desc:
This allows you to set custom NBT data to the item.
It is basically the part the /give command that follows
after the item name in curly brackets {}.

§lFull example command:
/give @a netherite_sword{display:{Name:'["",{"text":"Kinabra","italic":false}]'}}

§lSet this as value for NBT:
{display:{Name:'["",{"text":"Kinabra","italic":false}]'}}

There are lots of Give Command Generators available online,
so just ask Google about it and you will find something.
fancymenu.elements.parallax.desc:
If a parallax effect should get added to the element's position.

The parallax effect only works while not in the editor!
fancymenu.elements.parallax.intensity.de:
The intensity of the parallax effect.
This should be a value between 0.0 (no movement) and 1.0 (maximum movement).
fancymenu.elements.parallax.intensity.in: This needs to be a value between 0.0 (no movement) and 1.0 (maximum movement)!
fancymenu.elements.parallax.invert.desc:
When ENABLED, the element will move WITH the mouse.
When disabled, it will move in the opposite direction of the mouse.
This element lets you animate other elements by using keyframes!
It allows you to smoothly change the size and position of elements.
Edit, add, or remove animation keyframes.

If enabled, the Animator will not apply
the size of keyframes to the target elements.

If enabled, the Animator will not apply
the position of keyframes to the target elements.
Select elements that should be animated by the Element Animator.
This element is already a target!
Add or remove elements that should be animated by the Element Animator.
Set the recording speed to 0% to manually move the progress bar!
Set the recording speed to 0% to edit keyframes!

§lSelected Keyframe:
Time: %s
Position: (%s, %s)
Size: %sx%s
Anchor: %s
Sticky: %s

When enabled, the arrow keys will move the
preview element instead of the selected keyframe.

Lets you set the same distance between
keyframes for all selected keyframes.
Lets you edit the timestamp of the selected keyframe.

In offset mode, the target elements will use their
normal position as origin and get animated starting from this
position instead of getting their position completely overridden.

In this mode, keyframes get saved in a different way.
The middle of the screen (crosshair) stands for
the target element and you should record keyframes
around this crosshair.
Keyframes recorded in offset mode are not compatible
with the normal mode an vice-versa, so you should
choose a mode before start recording.
fancymenu.placeholders.math_ceil.desc:
Returns the smallest integer greater than or equal to the given number.
For example, ceil(3.14) = 4 and ceil(-3.14) = -3.
fancymenu.placeholders.math_floor.desc:
Returns the largest integer less than or equal to the given number.
For example, floor(3.14) = 3 and floor(-3.14) = -4.
fancymenu.placeholders.math_round.desc:
Rounds a number.
Set the optional 'decimals' value to control the decimal place (use 0 or -1 round to an integer).
Example 1: num=3.14159 & decimals=2 -> 3.14.
Example 2: num=3.14159 & decimals=0 -> 3.
fancymenu.placeholders.math_sign.desc:
Returns:
 1 if the number is positive
-1 if the number is negative
 0 if the number is zero
fancymenu.placeholders.switch_case.desc:
Matches a value against multiple cases and returns the corresponding result.
Format: value to match, case pairs (value:result) separated by commas, optional default case.
Example: value="1", cases="1:first,2:second", default="none"
fancymenu.layout.editor.edit_open_screen: This action script gets executed when opening the screen.
fancymenu.layout.editor.edit_close_scree: This action script gets executed when closing the screen.
Returns true only once per game session.
After returning true once, it will return false
until the game is restarted.
fancymenu.elements.element.load_once_per:
Enabling this will make the element only load once per game session.
It stays active/visible until the user opens a new screen.
The 'game session' ends when restarting the game.
fancymenu.elements.audio.manage_audios.w:
Track weights affect how likely each track is to be selected in shuffle mode.
Default weight is 1.0. Range is 0.0 to 5.0.
Weight 0.0: Track will never be selected in shuffle mode
Weight below 1.0: Track is less likely to be selected
Weight above 1.0: Track is more likely to be selected
fancymenu.placeholders.audio_element_cur:
Gets the filename or display name of the currently playing track in an Audio element.
Returns "---" when no track is playing.
Takes the element identifier of the target Audio element.
Optionally takes display name mappings to show custom names for tracks.
Mapping format: track1.ogg=>Cool Name%%:%%track2.wav=>Another Name
fancymenu.placeholders.audio_duration.de:
Returns the total duration of the current track
playing in an Audio element in MM:SS format (e.g. '03:45').
Returns '00:00' if no audio is playing.

Required values:
- element_identifier: The ID of the audio element to get the duration from
fancymenu.placeholders.audio_playtime.de:
Returns either the current play time of an Audio element
(MM:SS format) or the play progress percentage (0-100).
Returns '00:00' or '0' if no audio is playing.

Required values:
- element_identifier: The ID of the audio element
- show_percentage: Set to 'true' to show percentage instead of time
fancymenu.actions.audio.next_track.desc: Skips to the next track in an Audio element's playlist.
fancymenu.actions.audio.next_track.value: The identifier of the Audio element to control
fancymenu.actions.audio.previous_track.d: Returns to the previous track in an Audio element's playlist.
fancymenu.actions.audio.previous_track.v: The identifier of the Audio element to control
fancymenu.actions.audio.toggle_play.desc:
Toggles between playing and pausing an Audio element.
If paused, resumes playback. If playing, pauses playback.
fancymenu.actions.audio.toggle_play.valu: The identifier of the audio element to control
fancymenu.placeholders.audio_playing_sta:
Returns the current playing state of an Audio element.
Use 'element_identifier' to specify the Audio element.
Returns 'true' if the audio is playing, 'false' if paused or stopped.
fancymenu.editor.elements.in_editor_colo: Set a custom in-editor color to help with organization.
fancymenu.elements.in_editor_display_nam:
The in-editor display name helps with organization.
It is shown in the layers widget and when
you pick an element using the right-click menu.
fancymenu.helper.editor.items.visibility:
Triggers when the specified mouse button is clicked.
Use 'left' or 'right' to select the button.
Only triggers once per click.
fancymenu.placeholders.world.current_pla: Current Player Oxygen Level

Returns the current oxygen level of the player.
Returns '0.0' when not in a world.
fancymenu.placeholders.world.max_player_:
Returns the max oxygen level of the player.
Returns '0.0' when not in a world.
fancymenu.placeholders.world.current_pla: Current Player Oxygen Level (Percent)

Returns the current oxygen level of the player in percent.
Returns '0' when not in a world.
Possible Values: 0-100
fancymenu.commmands.layout.unable_to_set: [FANCYMENU] Unable to set layout state of '%s'! Layout not found!
fancymenu.commmands.layout.error: [FANCYMENU] An error happened while trying to set layout state of '%s'!
fancymenu.placeholders.last_world_server:
Returns the last world or server the player joined.
You can control via the 'type' value if the placeholder
should return both servers and worlds or only one of them.

Types: both, world, server

The 'full_world_path' value controls if the full path or
only the name of the world (not server) should get returned.
Setting this to 'false' will only return the world name.
fancymenu.elements.button.template_setti:
When you enable the template mode for a custom button, it will apply
some of its settings to all other buttons or sliders in the current screen.

Template buttons will be §linvisible§r outside the editor.

When you set the template to share settings with sliders, the
settings for the button textures will change to slider texture settings.

§lSettings that get shared are:

- Button/Slider Textures
- Button Click Sounds
- Button/Slider Hover Sounds
- Button/Slider Position (if enabled)
- Button/Slider Size (if enabled)
- Button/Slider Opacity (if enabled)
- Button/Slider Visibility (if enabled)
- Button/Slider Label (if enabled)
fancymenu.actions.generic.async_error: The '%s' action can't get executed asynchronously!
fancymenu.requirements.is_internet_conne: Returns true when there is a working internet connection available.
fancymenu.layout_editor.grid.snapping.de: If elements should snap to the grid lines when being moved.
fancymenu.layout_editor.grid.snapping.st:
Controls how strongly elements snap to grid lines.
Lower values require more precision.
Higher values snap from further away.
fancymenu.editor.text_editor.single_line:
The target needs a single-line text, which means all lines will
get merged into one line and all leading spaces of all lines
except the very first line will get removed in the actual
output text for the target.
fancymenu.actions.back_to_last_screen.de: Opens the last screen that was open before the current one.
fancymenu.elements.video_mcef.desc:
A video player powered by MCEF.
§xThis element needs the MCEF mod to work!
fancymenu.actions.video.set_video_elemen:
Sets the volume of a Video element.
The volume has to be a valid decimal between 0.0 (0%%) and 1.0 (100%%).
Video Element Identifier + Volume [ Separated by : ]
fancymenu.placeholders.video_element_vol:
Returns the volume of a Video element.
The volume is a decimal between 0.0 (0%%) and 1.0 (100%%).
fancymenu.actions.video.toggle_paused_st: Toggles the paused state of a Video element.
fancymenu.placeholders.video_element_dur:
Returns the total duration of a Video element in MM:SS format (e.g. '03:45').
Returns '00:00' if the element is not ready yet or not video is set.

Required values:
- element_identifier: The ID of the Video element to get the duration from
fancymenu.placeholders.video_element_pla:
Returns either the current play time of a Video element
(MM:SS format) or the play progress percentage (0-100).
Returns '00:00' or '0' if the element is not ready yet or no video is set.

Required values:
- element_identifier: The ID of the Video element
- show_percentage: Set to 'true' to show percentage instead of time
fancymenu.placeholders.video_paused_stat:
Returns the paused state of a Video element.
Returns 'true' when the element is paused, otherwise returns 'false'.
fancymenu.backgrounds.video_mcef.desc:
Plays a video file as menu background.
§xThis background needs the MCEF mod to work!
fancymenu.backgrounds.video_mcef.configu: §xYou need to choose a video first!
fancymenu.actions.video.set_video_backgr:
Sets the volume of a Video menu background by its identifier.
The volume has to be a valid decimal between 0.0 (0%%) and 1.0 (100%%).

To get the identifier of a background, right-click the
editor background and click on 'Copy Background Identifier'.
Video Background Identifier + Volume [ Separated by : ]
fancymenu.actions.video.background.toggl:
Toggles the paused state of a Video menu background by its identifier.

To get the identifier of a background, right-click the
editor background and click on 'Copy Background Identifier'.
fancymenu.placeholders.video_background_:
Returns the total duration of a Video menu background in MM:SS format (e.g. '03:45') by its identifier.
Returns '00:00' if the background is not ready yet or not video is set.

To get the identifier of a background, right-click the
editor background and click on 'Copy Background Identifier'.

Returns the paused state of a Video menu background by its identifier.
Returns 'true' when the element is paused, otherwise returns 'false'.

To get the identifier of a background, right-click the
editor background and click on 'Copy Background Identifier'.

Returns either the current play time of a Video menu background
(MM:SS format) or the play progress percentage (0-100).
Returns '00:00' or '0' if the element is not ready yet or no video is set.

Required values:
- background_identifier: The ID of the Video background
- show_percentage: Set to 'true' to show percentage instead of time

To get the identifier of a background, right-click the
editor background and click on 'Copy Background Identifier'.

Returns the volume of a Video menu background by its identifier.
The volume is a decimal between 0.0 (0%%) and 1.0 (100%%).

To get the identifier of a background, right-click the
editor background and click on 'Copy Background Identifier'.
fancymenu.editor.background_options.copy:
This will copy the identifier of the
current menu background to the clipboard.

The background identifier is used by actions, placeholders
and similar stuff to communicate with the background instance.
fancymenu.editor.buddy.enable.desc:
If a cute little pet creature should
walk around at the bottom of the editor screen.
fancymenu.elements.tooltip.desc:
Renders a tooltip at a specific position or the mouse position.
Has full Markdown support, similar to Text elements.
Control its visibility with loading requirements.
fancymenu.elements.tooltip.background_te:
Set a custom background texture.
Uses nine-slicing to resize the texture for the current tooltip size.
fancymenu.elements.tooltip.nine_slice.de:
Here you can set settings related to the
nine-slicing logic of the custom tooltip background.
fancymenu.elements.tooltip.mouse_followi: If the tooltip should follow the mouse when outside the editor.
fancymenu.placeholders.text_char_count.d: Returns the character count of the given text.
fancymenu.placeholders.text_width.desc:
Returns the width in pixels of the given text.
Useful for calculating element positions or sizes based on text width.
fancymenu.placeholders.clipboard_content:
Returns the current text content of the system's clipboard
or an empty text if nothing is currently stored in the clipboard.
fancymenu.placeholders.player_team.desc:
Returns the current team of the given player
or an empty value if the player has no team.
Returns the score value of a player for a specific objective.
Returns an empty value if the player has no score for that objective.

Required values:
- player: The player name to check
- objective: The objective name to get the score from
fancymenu.placeholders.scoreboard.object:
Returns a list of all objectives in the scoreboard.
Each objective name is separated by the specified separator.

Optional values:
- separator: The text to separate objectives (default: ', ')
fancymenu.placeholders.scoreboard.tracke:
Returns a list of all players tracked by the scoreboard.
Players who have any score in any objective will be listed.

Optional values:
- separator: The text to separate player names (default: ', ')
fancymenu.placeholders.scoreboard.displa:
Returns the name of the objective displayed in a specific slot.
Returns an empty value if no objective is assigned to that slot.

Required values:
- slot: The display slot to check
  Valid slots: sidebar, list, below_name, or team color slots
  (e.g., sidebar.team.red, sidebar.team.blue)
fancymenu.placeholders.scoreboard.has_sc:
Checks if a player has a score for a specific objective.
Returns 'true' if the player has a score, 'false' otherwise.

Required values:
- player: The player name to check
- objective: The objective name to check
fancymenu.placeholders.scoreboard.object:
Returns the display name of an objective.
Can return as plain text or JSON format for advanced formatting.

Required values:
- objective: The objective name

Optional values:
- as_json: Set to 'true' to get JSON format (default: 'false')

Returns the criteria type of an objective.
Common criteria: dummy, trigger, deathCount, playerKillCount,
totalKillCount, health, food, air, armor, xp, level, etc.

Required values:
- objective: The objective name to check

Returns how an objective's scores are displayed.
Possible values: 'integer' (normal numbers) or 'hearts' (heart icons).

Required values:
- objective: The objective name to check
fancymenu.placeholders.scoreboard.player:
Returns a formatted list of all scores for a specific player.
Use %%objective%% and %%score%% in the format to customize output.

Required values:
- player: The player name to list scores for

Optional values:
- separator: Text between each score entry (default: ', ')
- format: How to format each entry (default: '%%objective%%: %%score%%')
fancymenu.placeholders.scoreboard.object:
Returns the total number of objectives in the scoreboard.
Returns '0' if no objectives exist.
fancymenu.placeholders.world.players_lis:
Returns a list of all players currently in the world.
Player names are sorted alphabetically.

Optional values:
- separator: The text to separate player names (default: ', ')
fancymenu.placeholders.replace_text.desc:
Replaces text in a string using either literal text or regular expressions (regex).
Supports both single replacement and replace-all operations.

Required values:
- text: The input text to perform replacements on
- search: The text or regex pattern to search for

Optional values:
- replacement: The replacement text (default: empty string)
- use_regex: Set to 'true' to use regex patterns (default: 'false')
- replace_all: Set to 'true' to replace all occurrences, otherwise only first occurrence (default: 'true')

When using regex, you can use capture groups like $1, $2, etc.
fancymenu.placeholders.nbt_data_get.desc:
Gets NBT data from entities and blocks (similar to '/data get' command).
Returns the value at the specified NBT path.

§lTIP: §rUse the '/data get' command in-game without setting a path
to easily get all available NBT paths for an entity or block!

Required values:
- source_type: The data source type ('entity' or 'block')
- nbt_path: The NBT path to query (e.g. 'foodLevel', 'Pos[0]', 'Inventory[0].id')

Conditional values:
- entity_selector: Entity selector when source_type is 'entity'
  Supports: @s (self), @p (nearest player), @e (nearest entity),
  UUID, or entity name
- block_pos: Block position when source_type is 'block'
  Format: 'x y z' (e.g. '100 64 -200')

Optional values:
- scale: Scale factor for numeric values (default: 1.0)
- return_type: How to return the data (default: 'value')
  Options: 'value' (numeric/size), 'string' (text value),
  'snbt' (formatted NBT), 'json' (JSON format)

Returns empty string if data cannot be accessed or path is invalid.
fancymenu.placeholders.player_has_tag.de:
Checks if a specific player has a specific tag. Returns 'true' or 'false'.

These are the tags that you add via the '/tag' command.
Returns a list of all tags for a specific player, separated by the specified separator.

These are the tags that you add via the '/tag' command.
fancymenu.placeholders.file_text.desc:
Reads text from a local file or remote URL and returns it.
Supports reading entire content or only the last few lines.

Content is cached to improve performance:
- Local files: Re-read every 1 second
- URLs: Re-read every 10 seconds

Required values:
- path_or_url: The file path or URL to read from
  Local files: Use relative paths (e.g. 'config/myfile.txt')
  Remote files: Use HTTP/HTTPS URLs (e.g. 'https://example.com/data.txt')
  
The file path can start with '.minecraft/' to target the default .minecraft directory.

Optional values:
- mode: How to read the content (default: 'all')
  Options: 'all' (entire content), 'last' (last X lines)
- separator: Text between lines when joining (default: '\n')
  Common options: '\n' (newline), ' | ', ', ', ' '
- last_lines: Number of lines to return in 'last' mode (default: 1)
  Only used when mode is 'last'

Note: When mode is 'last' with last_lines set to 1,
the single line is returned without any separator.

Returns empty string if source is not cached yet, doesn't exist,
cannot be read, or if there's no internet connection for URLs.
fancymenu.scroll_screen_normalizer: Expose Scroll Area Content Of Current Screen: %s
fancymenu.scroll_screen_normalizer.desc:
This will try to extract buttons and sliders from scroll areas
of the current screen, if it contains scroll areas.

This is useful to make, for example, options screens customizable.
fancymenu.customization.items.text.markd: Customize the appearance of Markdown tables.
The color used for every second row when 'Alternate Row Colors' is enabled.

The padding inside table cells.
Higher values create more space between content and cell borders.

The margin around tables.
Adds space above and below each table.
fancymenu.placeholders.uppercase_text.de:
Converts the input text to uppercase letters.

Example:
Input: Hello World
Output: HELLO WORLD
fancymenu.placeholders.lowercase_text.de:
Converts the input text to lowercase letters.

Example:
Input: HELLO WORLD
Output: hello world
fancymenu.elements.checkbox.desc:
A clickable checkbox that can execute actions when toggled.

Use the '$$value' placeholder in its actions and loading requirements
to get the current checkbox state (true/false).
fancymenu.elements.checkbox.background_t: The normal background texture. The default texture is 20x20 pixels.
The hover background texture. The default texture is 20x20 pixels.
The inactive background texture. The default texture is 20x20 pixels.
fancymenu.elements.checkbox.checkmark_te:
The texture displayed when the checkbox is checked.
Leave empty to use the default checkmark.

The default checkmark texture is 20x20 pixels.
fancymenu.editor.elements.checkbox.manag:
Actions will be executed when the checkbox is toggled.

You can use the '$$value' placeholder in actions
to get the current checkbox state (true/false).
The amount of time in milliseconds FancyMenu should cache
replaced text of placeholders to make them less performance-heavy.

Setting this to 0 will disable caching.

§l§xCaching can cause unexpected behaviour in complex setups and action scripts!
The amount of time in milliseconds FancyMenu should cache
the state of requirements to make them less performance-heavy.

Setting this to 0 will disable caching.

§l§xCaching can cause unexpected behaviour in complex setups and action scripts!
fancymenu.requirements.is_mcef_loaded.de:
Checks if the MCEF mod is loaded.

This mod is needed for the Browser element and for all
video-related features like the Video element and menu background.
fancymenu.actions.send_http_request.desc:
Sends an HTTP request to a web target with configurable parameters.

This action allows you to send data to REST APIs, webhooks, or any HTTP endpoint.
Supports various authentication methods, custom headers, and different request types.
fancymenu.actions.send_http_request.edit:
The name of a FancyMenu variable the response should get written to.

§xIt's important to note that this action gets executed asynchronously,
§xso the variable value is not updated yet right after the action got executed.
Store Response as Single-Line in Variable: %s
fancymenu.placeholders.world.level_save_:
Returns a list of all available local world save names.

Values:
§eseparator§r = The separator text between world names. Default is ', '.

Returns the complete level data of a specific world save as single-line JSON.

Values:
§elevel_name§r = The exact name of the world save to get data for.
fancymenu.background.image.restart_anima: Restart Animated Textures When Opening Screen: %s
fancymenu.elements.image.restart_animate: Restart Animated Textures When Opening Screen: %s
fancymenu.listeners.manage.desc:
Listeners are a very powerful feature that allows you
to execute an action script when specific things happen,
like when a user types on their keyboard, performs a mouse click
or even when things happen in worlds, like when the player dies.

Listeners aren't bound to screens, to they constantly
listen for events, even if there isn't a screen open at all,
like when playing in a singleplayer world or on a server.
fancymenu.listeners.on_key_pressed.desc:
This listener triggers whenever a keyboard key is pressed, which works both while a screen is open and when in-game (in a world/server). The listener keeps firing while the key is held down and the screen continues to receive repeat events.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$key_name §r= The resolved display name of the key
- §z$$key_keycode §r= The GLFW key code
- §z$$key_scancode §r= The GLFW scan code
- §z$$key_modifiers §r= The active modifier bit mask
fancymenu.listeners.on_key_released.desc:
This listener triggers whenever a keyboard key is released, which works both while a screen is open and when in-game (in a world/server).

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$key_name §r= The resolved display name of the key
- §z$$key_keycode §r= The GLFW key code
- §z$$key_scancode §r= The GLFW scan code
- §z$$key_modifiers §r= The active modifier bit mask
fancymenu.listeners.on_char_typed: On Keyboard Character Typed in Screen
fancymenu.listeners.on_char_typed.desc:
This listener triggers whenever a character is typed in a screen.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$char §r= The typed character
fancymenu.listeners.on_mouse_moved.desc:
This listener triggers whenever the mouse cursor moves while a screen is open.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$mouse_pos_x §r= The current mouse X position
- §z$$mouse_pos_y §r= The current mouse Y position
- §z$$mouse_move_delta_x §r= The horizontal distance moved since the last event
- §z$$mouse_move_delta_y §r= The vertical distance moved since the last event
fancymenu.listeners.on_mouse_button_clic:
This listener triggers once when a mouse button is pressed, which works both while a screen is open and when in-game (in a world/server).

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$button §r= Which button was pressed (left, right, middle)
- §z$$mouse_pos_x §r= The current mouse X position
- §z$$mouse_pos_y §r= The current mouse Y position
fancymenu.listeners.on_mouse_button_rele:
This listener triggers once when a mouse button is released, which works both while a screen is open and when in-game (in a world/server).

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$button §r= Which button was released (left, right, middle)
- §z$$mouse_pos_x §r= The current mouse X position
- §z$$mouse_pos_y §r= The current mouse Y position
fancymenu.listeners.on_mouse_scrolled.de:
This listener triggers whenever the mouse wheel is scrolled while a screen is open.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$scroll_delta_y §r= The vertical scroll amount for the event
This listener triggers whenever a FancyMenu variable gets updated/set.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$var_name §r= The variable name
- §z$$old_value §r= The old variable value
- §z$$new_value §r= The new variable value
fancymenu.listeners.on_file_downloaded.d:
This listener triggers when a file finishes downloading via the 'Download File to Game Directory' action.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$download_url §r= The URL of the file that got downloaded
- §z$$target_file_path §r= The path the file got saved to
- §z$$download_succeeded §r= If the file download was successful (true/false)
fancymenu.actions.manage.no_value_to_edi: §xThe selected action has no value to edit.
fancymenu.actions.print_to_log.desc: This action will print text to the game's log/console for debugging.
fancymenu.actions.delete_file.desc:
This action deletes a file or folder in the game directory, which starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory. This action is limited to work only inside the game directory for safety reasons.

It is also possible to access the default '.minecraft' directory with this action. For that, just start paths with the '.minecraft/' prefix.

Append '*' to the end of the target path to delete every file directly inside that folder. This wildcard ignores sub-directories and leaves the folder itself intact.
fancymenu.actions.move_file.desc:
This action moves a file or folder in the game directory, which starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory. This action is limited to work only inside the game directory for safety reasons.

It is also possible to access the default '.minecraft' directory with this action. For that, just start paths with the '.minecraft/' prefix.

Append '*' to the end of the source path to move every file directly inside that folder. This wildcard ignores sub-directories and requires the destination to be a directory.
fancymenu.actions.copy_file.desc:
This action copies a file or folder in the game directory, which starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory. This action is limited to work only inside the game directory for safety reasons.

It is also possible to access the default '.minecraft' directory with this action. For that, just start paths with the '.minecraft/' prefix.

Append '*' to the end of the source path to copy every file directly inside that folder. This wildcard ignores sub-directories and requires the destination to be a directory.
fancymenu.actions.rename_file.desc:
This action renames a file or folder in the game directory, which starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory. This action is limited to work only inside the game directory for safety reasons.

It is also possible to access the default '.minecraft' directory with this action. For that, just start paths with the '.minecraft/' prefix.

Renaming a folder keeps its contents intact while updating its name.
fancymenu.actions.download_file.desc:
This action downloads a file from a URL and saves it to the game directory, which starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory. This action is limited to work only inside the game directory for safety reasons.

Provide the download folder instead of a file name; FancyMenu derives the saved file name from the HTTP response headers or the URL automatically.

§lAsynchronous Download:§r This action downloads files asynchronously, which means the download happens in the background without freezing or blocking the game. The game will continue running normally while the file is being downloaded.

It is also possible to access the default '.minecraft' directory with this action. For that, just start paths with the '.minecraft/' prefix.
fancymenu.actions.write_file.desc:
This action writes content to a file in the game directory, which starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory. If the file doesn't exist, it will be created. This action is limited to work only inside the game directory for safety reasons.

It is also possible to access the default '.minecraft' directory with this action. For that, just start paths with the '.minecraft/' prefix.
fancymenu.actions.write_file.edit.target:
The path to the file to write to.
Starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory.
Use '.minecraft/' prefix to access the default .minecraft directory.
fancymenu.actions.write_file.edit.conten:
The content to write to the file.
Use '\n' to represent line breaks. Click the edit button for multi-line editing.
fancymenu.actions.write_file.edit.mode.d: Choose whether to override the entire file content or append to the existing content.
fancymenu.actions.create_file.desc:
This action creates a new empty file in the game directory, which starts at the root of the Minecraft instance directory. The file will only be created if it doesn't already exist. This action is limited to work only inside the game directory for safety reasons.

It is also possible to access the default '.minecraft' directory with this action. For that, just start paths with the '.minecraft/' prefix.
fancymenu.placeholders.file_size.desc:
Returns the size of a local file in bytes.
Only supports local files, not URLs.
Returns 0 if the file doesn't exist or cannot be read.

You can target the default '.minecraft'
directory by starting the file path with '.minecraft/'.
fancymenu.placeholders.file_md5.desc:
Returns the MD5 hash of a local file.
Only supports local files, not URLs.
Returns an empty string if the file doesn't exist or cannot be read.

You can target the default '.minecraft'
directory by starting the file path with '.minecraft/'.
fancymenu.elements.player_entity.body_mo: If the player's pose should be animated.
fancymenu.requirements.is_any_screen_ope:
Returns true if any screen is open.
For example, this will return false if the user is walking around in a world, because then there's no screen open.
It will return true if the Inventory or Pause screen is open.
This action reloads resource packs just like when pressing F3 + T.

This action can only execute once every 5 seconds to prevent your Minecraft from exploding.
fancymenu.element.rotation.degrees.desc:
Set the rotation angle in degrees for this element.
Positive values rotate clockwise.

This is the same as using the grabbers,
but more precise for full control.
fancymenu.element.rotation.advanced_mode:
Enabling this allows you to use placeholders in the element's
rotation degrees value, but it will also disable rotation grabbers.
fancymenu.actions.async.cant_run_async:
§l§xFailed to execute FancyMenu action!§r

You tried to asynchronously execute an action that only works on the game thread.
The action is probably part of a Ticker element that runs in Async mode.

§lAction Name: §x%s
fancymenu.requirements.async.cant_run_as:
§l§xFailed to check FancyMenu requirement!§r

You tried to asynchronously use an requirement that only works on the game thread.
The requirement is probably part of a Ticker element that runs in Async mode.

§lRequirement Name: §x%s
fancymenu.placeholders.async.cant_run_as:
§l§xFailed to parse FancyMenu placeholder!§r

You tried to asynchronously parse a placeholder that only works on the game thread.
The placeholder is probably part of a Ticker element that runs in Async mode.

§lPlaceholder Name: §x%s
fancymenu.editor.settings.enable_rotatio:
If elements should show controls for rotating them.
You can also set their rotation in their right-click menu.
fancymenu.editor.settings.enable_element:
If elements should show controls for tilting them.
You can also set their vertical/horizontal tilt in their right-click menu.
Set the vertical tilt angle in degrees for this element.
Positive values tilt the top away from the viewer.
Range: -60 to 60 degrees.

This is the same as using the grabbers,
but more precise for full control.
fancymenu.element.tilt.vertical.advanced:
Enabling this allows you to use placeholders in the element's
vertical tilt degrees value, but it will also disable tilt grabbers.
fancymenu.element.tilt.horizontal.degree:
Set the horizontal tilt angle in degrees for this element.
Positive values tilt the right side away from the viewer.
Range: -60 to 60 degrees.

This is the same as using the grabbers,
but more precise for full control.
fancymenu.element.tilt.horizontal.advanc:
Enabling this allows you to use placeholders in the element's
horizontal tilt degrees value, but it will also disable tilt grabbers.
fancymenu.listeners.on_open_screen.desc:
Triggers immediately after a screen becomes active, allowing actions such as "Open Screen or Custom GUI" to override it.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$screen_identifier §r= Identifier of the screen that just opened
fancymenu.listeners.on_close_screen.desc:
Triggers right after a screen got closed.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$screen_identifier §r= Identifier of the screen that was closed
fancymenu.listeners.on_server_joined.des:
Triggers after the client finishes joining a multiplayer server.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$server_ip §r= IP address of the server the player joined
fancymenu.listeners.on_server_left.desc:
Triggers after the client disconnects from a multiplayer server.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$server_ip §r= IP address of the server the player left
This listener triggers once when the crosshair starts pointing at a block in the world.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$block_key §r= The resource location of the targeted block
- §z$$distance §r= The distance from the player's eyes to the block hit position
fancymenu.listeners.on_enter_biome.desc:
This listener triggers once when the player enters a new biome.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$biome_key §r= The resource location of the biome the player entered
fancymenu.listeners.on_leave_biome.desc:
This listener triggers once when the player leaves their current biome.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$biome_key §r= The resource location of the biome the player just left
fancymenu.listeners.on_enter_structure.d:
§xRequires FancyMenu on the server.§r

This listener triggers once when the player enters a structure using coarse structure-area detection.

Because it considers the entire structure footprint, it can also fire when a structure is near or below the player (for example, a mineshaft beneath the surface).

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$structure_key §r= The resource location of the structure the player entered
fancymenu.listeners.on_leave_structure.d:
§xRequires FancyMenu on the server.§r

This listener triggers once when the player leaves their current structure using coarse structure-area detection.

Because it considers the entire structure footprint, it can also fire when a structure is near or below the player (for example, a mineshaft beneath the surface).

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$structure_key §r= The resource location of the structure the player just left
fancymenu.listeners.on_enter_structure.h:
§xRequires FancyMenu on the server.§r

This listener triggers once when the player actually steps into a structure's interior.

It uses high precision detection, so it only fires when the player enters the structure's bounding boxes.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$structure_key §r= The resource location of the structure the player entered
fancymenu.listeners.on_leave_structure.h:
§xRequires FancyMenu on the server.§r

This listener triggers once when the player leaves the interior of their current structure.

It uses high precision detection, so it only fires after the player fully exits the structure's bounding boxes.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$structure_key §r= The resource location of the structure the player just left
fancymenu.listeners.on_start_swimming.de:
This listener triggers once when the player starts swimming.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$fluid_type §r= The resource location of the fluid the player started swimming in
fancymenu.listeners.on_stop_swimming.des:
This listener triggers once when the player stops swimming.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$fluid_type §r= The resource location of the fluid the player stopped swimming in
fancymenu.listeners.on_start_touching_fl:
This listener triggers once when the player starts touching a fluid.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$fluid_type §r= The resource location of the fluid the player touched
fancymenu.listeners.on_stop_touching_flu:
This listener triggers once when the player stops touching a fluid.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$fluid_type §r= The resource location of the fluid the player stopped touching
fancymenu.listeners.on_chat_message_rece:
Triggers whenever the client displays a normal player chat message.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$chat_message_string §r= Plain text version of the received chat line
- §z$$chat_message_component §r= Full component JSON of the received chat line
- §z$$sender_uuid §r= UUID of the sender (or ERROR if unavailable)
- §z$$sender_name §r= Plain name of the sender (or ERROR if unavailable)
fancymenu.listeners.on_chat_message_sent:
Triggers when the local player sends a chat message to the server.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$chat_message_string §r= Plain text version of the sent chat line
- §z$$chat_message_component §r= Full component JSON of the sent chat line
fancymenu.listeners.on_other_player_join:
Triggers when another player joins the current world or connected server.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$player_name §r= The plain name of the player who joined
- §z$$player_uuid §r= The UUID of the player who joined
fancymenu.listeners.on_other_player_left:
Triggers when another player leaves the current world or connected server.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$player_name §r= The plain name of the player who left
- §z$$player_uuid §r= The UUID of the player who left
fancymenu.listeners.on_death.desc:
Triggers right after the vanilla death screen opens for the local player.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$days_survived §r= In-game days survived (rounded down) since the last death
- §z$$death_reason_string §r= Plain text description of the death reason
- §z$$death_reason_component §r= Full component JSON of the death reason
- §z$$death_pos_x §r= X coordinate where the player died
- §z$$death_pos_y §r= Y coordinate where the player died
- §z$$death_pos_z §r= Z coordinate where the player died
fancymenu.listeners.on_other_player_died:
Triggers when another player in the current world dies.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$player_name §r= The plain name of the player who died
- §z$$player_uuid §r= The UUID of the player who died
- §z$$death_pos_x §r= X coordinate where the player died
- §z$$death_pos_y §r= Y coordinate where the player died
- §z$$death_pos_z §r= Z coordinate where the player died
fancymenu.listeners.on_quit_minecraft.de:
This listener triggers once when the Minecraft client begins shutting down.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$timestamp_millis §r= Epoch milliseconds when the quit event fired
- §z$$timestamp_iso §r= ISO-8601 timestamp representing the quit moment
fancymenu.listeners.on_stepping_on_block:
This listener triggers once when the player steps onto a block.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$block_key §r= The resource location of the block that was stepped on
- §z$$block_pos_x §r= The X coordinate of the block
- §z$$block_pos_y §r= The Y coordinate of the block
- §z$$block_pos_z §r= The Z coordinate of the block
fancymenu.listeners.on_looking_at_entity:
This listener triggers once when the crosshair starts pointing at an entity.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$entity_key §r= The resource location of the targeted entity type
- §z$$distance_to_player §r= The distance from the player's eyes to the entity hit position
- §z$$entity_pos_x §r= The entity's X coordinate
- §z$$entity_pos_y §r= The entity's Y coordinate
- §z$$entity_pos_z §r= The entity's Z coordinate
- §z$$entity_uuid §r= The UUID of the targeted entity
fancymenu.listeners.on_entity_in_sight.d:
This listener triggers once when an entity first becomes visible in the player's field of view (and is not farther away than 200 blocks).

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$entity_key §r= The resource location of the visible entity type
- §z$$distance_to_player §r= The distance from the player's eyes to the entity
- §z$$entity_pos_x §r= The entity's X coordinate
- §z$$entity_pos_y §r= The entity's Y coordinate
- §z$$entity_pos_z §r= The entity's Z coordinate
- §z$$entity_uuid §r= The UUID of the visible entity
fancymenu.listeners.on_interacted_with_e:
This listener triggers once when the player successfully interacts with an entity.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$entity_key §r= The resource location of the interacted entity type
- §z$$entity_pos_x §r= The entity's X coordinate at the time of interaction
- §z$$entity_pos_y §r= The entity's Y coordinate at the time of interaction
- §z$$entity_pos_z §r= The entity's Z coordinate at the time of interaction
- §z$$entity_uuid §r= The UUID of the interacted entity
fancymenu.listeners.on_entity_mounted.de:
This listener triggers once when the player begins riding an entity.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$entity_key §r= The resource location of the mounted entity type
- §z$$entity_pos_x §r= The entity's X coordinate when mounting started
- §z$$entity_pos_y §r= The entity's Y coordinate when mounting started
- §z$$entity_pos_z §r= The entity's Z coordinate when mounting started
- §z$$entity_uuid §r= The UUID of the mounted entity
This listener triggers once when the player stops riding their current entity.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$entity_key §r= The resource location of the entity that was dismounted
- §z$$entity_pos_x §r= The entity's X coordinate when dismounting
- §z$$entity_pos_y §r= The entity's Y coordinate when dismounting
- §z$$entity_pos_z §r= The entity's Z coordinate when dismounting
- §z$$entity_uuid §r= The UUID of the entity that was dismounted
fancymenu.listeners.on_entity_spawned.de:
§xRequires FancyMenu on the server.§r

This listener triggers whenever an entity spawns anywhere on the connected server/world (even if the player is far away or in another dimension).

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$entity_key §r= The resource location of the spawned entity type
- §z$$distance_to_player §r= The distance from the player to the spawn location (returns -1 when the entity spawned in another dimension)
- §z$$entity_pos_x §r= The entity's X coordinate at spawn time
- §z$$entity_pos_y §r= The entity's Y coordinate at spawn time
- §z$$entity_pos_z §r= The entity's Z coordinate at spawn time
- §z$$entity_uuid §r= The UUID of the spawned entity
- §z$$dimension_key §r= The dimension the entity spawned in
- §z$$is_same_dimension_as_player §r= If TRUE, the entity spawned in the same dimension as the player
fancymenu.listeners.on_entity_died.desc:
§xRequires FancyMenu on the server.§r

This listener triggers whenever an entity dies anywhere on the connected server/world (even if the player is far away or in another dimension).

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$entity_key §r= The resource location of the entity type that died
- §z$$distance_to_player §r= The distance from the player to the death position (returns -1 when the entity died in another dimension)
- §z$$death_pos_x §r= The X coordinate where the entity died
- §z$$death_pos_y §r= The Y coordinate where the entity died
- §z$$death_pos_z §r= The Z coordinate where the entity died
- §z$$entity_uuid §r= The UUID of the entity that died
- §z$$dimension_key §r= The dimension the entity died in
- §z$$damage_type §r= The resource location of the damage type that caused the death
- §z$$is_same_dimension_as_player §r= If TRUE, the entity died in the same dimension as the player
- §z$$entity_killed_by_name §r= The plain text name of the killer or NONE when unavailable
- §z$$entity_killed_by_key §r= The resource location of the killer's type (uses minecraft:player for players, NONE when unavailable)
- §z$$entity_killed_by_uuid §r= The UUID of the killer or NONE when unavailable
fancymenu.listeners.on_item_picked_up.de:
This listener triggers once when the player picks up an item entity.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$item_key §r= The resource location of the item that was picked up
fancymenu.listeners.on_item_dropped.desc:
This listener triggers once when the player drops an item from their inventory.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$item_key §r= The resource location of the item that was dropped
fancymenu.listeners.on_item_consumed.des:
This listener triggers once when the player finishes consuming an item.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$item_key §r= The resource location of the item that was consumed
fancymenu.listeners.on_block_broke.desc:
This listener triggers once when the player breaks a block.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$block_key §r= The resource location of the broken block
- §z$$broke_with_item_key §r= The resource location of the item/tool that was used (or EMPTY when nothing was held)
- §z$$block_pos_x §r= The X coordinate of the broken block
- §z$$block_pos_y §r= The Y coordinate of the broken block
- §z$$block_pos_z §r= The Z coordinate of the broken block
fancymenu.listeners.on_block_placed.desc:
This listener triggers once when the player places a block.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$block_key §r= The resource location of the placed block
- §z$$block_pos_x §r= The X coordinate of the placed block
- §z$$block_pos_y §r= The Y coordinate of the placed block
- §z$$block_pos_z §r= The Z coordinate of the placed block
This listener triggers once whenever the local player's block position changes.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$old_pos_x §r= Previous block X coordinate
- §z$old_pos_y §r= Previous block Y coordinate
- §z$old_pos_z §r= Previous block Z coordinate
- §z$new_pos_x §r= New block X coordinate
- §z$new_pos_y §r= New block Y coordinate
- §z$new_pos_z §r= New block Z coordinate
fancymenu.listeners.on_jump.desc: This listener triggers once whenever the local player performs a jump action.
fancymenu.listeners.on_dimension_entered:
This listener triggers once when the player enters a new dimension.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$dimension_key §r= The resource location of the entered dimension
fancymenu.listeners.on_item_broke.desc:
This listener triggers once when an item in the player's inventory breaks.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$item_key §r= The resource location of the broken item
- §z$$item_type §r= Category of the broken item (tool, armor, other)
fancymenu.listeners.on_interacted_with_b:
This listener triggers once when the player successfully interacts with a block.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$block_key §r= The resource location of the interacted block
- §z$$block_pos_x §r= The X coordinate of the block
- §z$$block_pos_y §r= The Y coordinate of the block
- §z$$block_pos_z §r= The Z coordinate of the block
fancymenu.listeners.on_started_burning.d: This listener triggers once when the player starts burning.
fancymenu.listeners.on_stopped_burning.d: This listener triggers once when the player stops burning.
This listener triggers once when the player begins taking drowning damage.
fancymenu.listeners.on_music_track_start:
This listener triggers once when a new music track starts playing.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$track_resource_location §r= The resolved resource location of the audio file that started
- §z$$track_display_name §r= Human-readable track name when available, otherwise UNKNOWN
- §z$$track_artist §r= Reported track artist when available, otherwise UNKNOWN
- §z$$track_duration_ms §r= Track duration expressed in milliseconds (0 when unknown)
fancymenu.listeners.on_music_track_stopp:
This listener triggers once when the current music track stops playing (naturally or because it was replaced).

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$track_resource_location §r= The resolved resource location of the audio file that stopped
- §z$$track_display_name §r= Human-readable track name when available, otherwise UNKNOWN
- §z$$track_artist §r= Reported track artist when available, otherwise UNKNOWN
- §z$$track_duration_ms §r= Track duration expressed in milliseconds (0 when unknown)
fancymenu.listeners.on_effect_gained.des:
This listener triggers once when the player gains a status effect.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$effect_key §r= The resource location of the effect that was applied
- §z$$effect_type §r= The effect category (positive, negative, neutral)
- §z$$effect_duration §r= The effect duration in ticks remaining
fancymenu.listeners.on_effect_lost.desc:
This listener triggers once when the player loses a status effect.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$effect_key §r= The resource location of the effect that expired
- §z$$effect_type §r= The effect category (positive, negative, neutral)
fancymenu.listeners.on_experience_change:
This listener triggers whenever the player's total experience amount changes (gaining or losing XP).

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$new_experience_amount §r= The player's total experience value after the change
- §z$$old_experience_amount §r= The player's total experience value before the change
- §z$$is_level_up §r= TRUE when the change increased the player's level
fancymenu.listeners.on_damage_taken.desc:
This listener triggers once when the player takes damage.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$damage_amount §r= The amount of health removed by the hit
- §z$$damage_type §r= The resource location of the damage type
- §z$$is_fatal_damage §r= TRUE when the hit reduced the player to zero health
- §z$$damage_source §r= The resource location of the entity that caused the damage or NONE when unavailable
This listener triggers once when the player starts freezing.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$freezing_intensity §r= The current freezing intensity (0.0 = no freeze, 1.0 = fully frozen)
This listener triggers once when the player stops freezing.
fancymenu.listeners.on_item_used.desc:
This listener triggers once when the player uses an item.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$item_key §r= The resource location of the item that was used
- §z$$used_on_type §r= The interaction context (block, entity, self, none)
- §z$$used_on_entity_key §r= The resource location of the entity type that was targeted, empty when none
- §z$$used_on_block_key §r= The resource location of the block that was targeted, empty when none
- §z$$target_pos_x §r= Target X position when available, otherwise -1
- §z$$target_pos_y §r= Target Y position when available, otherwise -1
- §z$$target_pos_z §r= Target Z position when available, otherwise -1
fancymenu.listeners.on_world_sound_trigg:
This listener triggers whenever a positional world sound starts playing near the player.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$sound_resource_location §r= The resolved resource location of the sound file that started
- §z$$sound_display_name §r= The localized display name shown in the subtitles overlay when available
- §z$$sound_origin_pos_x §r= The X position of the sound's origin
- §z$$sound_origin_pos_y §r= The Y position of the sound's origin
- §z$$sound_origin_pos_z §r= The Z position of the sound's origin
- §z$$sound_origin_distance_to_player §r= The distance between the player and the sound origin
- §z$$sound_origin_direction_from_player §r= Direction in degrees (0-360) relative to where the player is facing when the sound started
fancymenu.listeners.on_fully_frozen.desc: This listener triggers once when the player becomes fully frozen.
fancymenu.listeners.on_started_running.d: This listener triggers once when the player starts sprinting.
fancymenu.listeners.on_stopped_running.d: This listener triggers once when the player stops sprinting.
fancymenu.listeners.on_weather_changed.d:
This listener triggers once whenever the weather state changes (clear, rain, or thunder).
It will also re-trigger when the local weather changes, which means if it is raining, for example, and you enter a biome that has no rain (desert) or a biome where it is snowing, the listener will re-trigger even though the global weather didn't change.
Entering a building also counts as local weather change while it is raining outside, because well, it doesn't rain inside.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$weather_type §r= The new global weather type (clear, rain, thunder)
- §z$$weather_can_snow §r= TRUE when precipitation at the player renders as snow
- §z$$weather_can_rain §r= TRUE when precipitation at the player renders as rain
fancymenu.requirements.is_resource_pack_: Returns TRUE when the named resource pack is currently enabled. Use the display name shown in the Resource Packs screen.
fancymenu.requirements.world.has_player_: Returns TRUE when the current player has at least the specified permission level (0-4). Level 4 is the default level set via the OP command. Works in singleplayer worlds and multiplayer servers where permission data is available.
fancymenu.actions.display_in_chat_client: Prints text directly to your local chat without contacting the server. Supports formatting codes using the '&' prefix and serialized JSON text components.
Chat Message [Plain Text or Serialized JSON Component]
fancymenu.actions.manage_resource_pack.d:
Enable, disable, or toggle a resource pack by matching its display name.
Optionally skip the automatic reload when you want to trigger it later.
fancymenu.actions.manage_resource_pack.e: Enter the display name exactly as shown in the Resource Packs screen. Placeholders are supported.
Choose whether this action enables, disables, or toggles the selected pack.
Toggle whether FancyMenu should call the resource reload immediately after the selection changes.
fancymenu.actions.mimic_keybind.desc: Runs the selected Minecraft keybind as though it was pressed. Combine with placeholders to trigger controls remotely.
fancymenu.actions.mimic_keybind.error: FancyMenu could not find the requested keybind. Double-check the identifier and try again.
fancymenu.actions.mimic_keybind.edit.kee: Hold the key for the specified duration by repeatedly re-triggering it if necessary.
fancymenu.actions.mimic_keybind.edit.pre: When Keep Pressed is enabled, the key stays down for this many milliseconds before being released.
fancymenu.placeholders.uptime_seconds.de: Returns the time since the game launched in seconds or, if "output_as_millis" is true, in milliseconds.
fancymenu.actions.manage.folder_no_edit: §xFolders only organize other actions, nothing to edit.
fancymenu.placeholders.nbt_data_get.clie:
Reads NBT directly from the client's world state.
Supports entity selectors with type/name/tag/limit/sort/distance/x/y/z/dx/dy/dz options,
plus absolute or relative block positions, returning value,
string, or SNBT formats entirely client-side.
fancymenu.listeners.on_world_entered.des:
Triggers after a singleplayer world finishes loading and the player regains control.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$world_name §r= Display name of the world
- §z$$world_save_path §r= Absolute path to the world save folder
- §z$$world_difficulty §r= Current game difficulty key
- §z$$world_cheats_allowed §r= TRUE when cheats are enabled
- §z$$world_icon_path §r= Absolute path to the world icon
- §z$$world_is_first_join §r= TRUE when this is the very first visit after creation
fancymenu.listeners.on_world_left.desc:
Triggers after a singleplayer world closes and finishes saving.

It provides the following variables for its actions and requirements:

- §z$$world_name §r= Display name of the world
- §z$$world_save_path §r= Absolute path to the world save folder
- §z$$world_difficulty §r= Last known game difficulty key
- §z$$world_cheats_allowed §r= TRUE when cheats were enabled
- §z$$world_icon_path §r= Absolute path to the world icon
fancymenu.editor.actions.open_action_cho: Opens the full Action Chooser screen with search bar for finding actions more easily.
fancymenu.actions.animation.reset_elemen: Resets the selected Element Animator and restarts its animation playback for all linked targets.
fancymenu.actions.animation.toggle_eleme: Toggles whether the Element Animator plays its animation for linked targets. The state persists across sessions.
fancymenu.actions.animation.enable_eleme: Enables the Element Animator and restarts its animation playback for all assigned targets.
fancymenu.actions.animation.disable_elem: Disables the Element Animator and stops its animation for all assigned targets.
fancymenu.placeholders.number_base_conve:
Converts a number between bases (supports decimals).
Values: input, from_base (2-36), to_base (2-36).
Up to 16 fractional digits are generated in the target base.
Example: input=67, from_base=10, to_base=2 -> 1000011.
